overview:
Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of FasPark, Tenured Associate Professor at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, and an innovator in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Data Analytics.

Eyal received his PhD in Computer Science from Stanford University in 2002, was a postdoctoral researcher at UC Berkeley, and joined the faculty of Computer Science at the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign. He co-founded FasPark in 2010 with Sergei Kozyrenko and led it to several successes in both product development, sales, company awards, and recruiting stellar personnel.

In his academic career Eyal conducts research on logical and probabilistic inference, knowledge representation, machine learning, and computerize decision making. He received a number of awards for his research, including best thesis at Stanford University Computer Science (2001-2002) and IEEE 10-to-watch in AI list (2006).
